content:
hey all -- just wanted to note here as well -- I've put up https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93685 to drop the current-month date generation into the manpages we produce. IMO, these manpages are likely largely unused by users using rustup (since they won't be in MANPATH by default), but distro users are more likely to stumble across them. So I thought I'd mention this PR here in case @cuviper has an opinion as our resident distro person :)

I think I've seen really old manpages on my system even for (presumably) not that old tooling, so I suspect the date in this file is something most people aren't really caring for.
I have no particular opinion about that date. Updating it on edit seems fine to me, and hopefully it's not left too neglected, but in reality I'm sure most don't think about it.
Yeah, if we edited these files... even once a year, I'd care more
